channel.title: Linux...no Linux
channel.description:
hey I'm just wondering what the upsides are of getting Linux over windows is ubunto better then windows will my comp get messed up if I dual boot it or should I just stay with my normal windows and do u have to have a dual boot to sun Linux(sorry I'm new to all this) or Isis just an operating system like windows
if you can answer these questions for me it would be greatly apreciated

Thank you guys I’m thinking about dual booting my computer when I get my computer back my dad took my monitor…lol

item.title: Linux...no Linux
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Razr, post:1, topic:232865”]hey I’m just wondering what the upsides are of getting Linux over windows is ubunto better then windows will my comp get messed up if I dual boot it or should I just stay with my normal windows and do u have to have a dual boot to sun Linux(sorry I’m new to all this) or Isis just an operating system like windows

if you can answer these questions for me it would be greatly apreciated[/quote]

It’s free, and very secure. The flavor of Linux you are referring to is actually called Ubuntu. There are some upsides, and there are some downsides. You might should try Wubi, it basically installs a Linux distribution of your choice like a piece of software onto your current operating system. It’s a full Linux distribution and is probably the best place for you to start. Or if you have the ability to burn CD’s you could create a LiveCD to just try Linux from the CD.

There is no such thing as Sun Linux to my knowledge, Sun has an operating system of their own called Solaris which uses the Gnome Desktop Environment(also used by Ubuntu). There are many differences between the Ubuntu Operating System and Windows, not only in the UI, but in many other areas.

I’m sure someone else could go into more detail on their differences, it’s really about the preference of the user. Some people are more comfortable with the Windows Operating System, others feel more at home with a Linux distribution.

Read full topic

chrisn2323:

There’s not really any upsides

There are many upsides.
